intro: Trembleya serrulata, commonly known as the serrated trembleya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and large, showy flowers. The leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, giving the plant its scientific name. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, facilitating its dispersal.
